techmeme.title: Google Chat is rolling out huddles to let users instantly start an audio-first meeting, with a floating window displaying controls to add video or share screens (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Spotify will no longer allow developers building new third-party apps with its Web API to access several features, such as song and artist recommendations (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
US filing: Google sent subpoenas in October 2024 to OpenAI, Perplexity AI, and Microsoft for the remedies part of the US v. Google search antitrust trial (Marty Swant/Digiday)
Sources: US FTC has opened an antitrust investigation of Microsoft, focusing on its cloud and software licensing business and its cybersecurity and AI products (Bloomberg)
Sriram Krishnan, a general partner at a16z, is leaving the firm; source: he has talked to Elon Musk about joining the Department of Government Efficiency (The Information)
